answers.answer: Sounds like you need to go to the diabetes specialist? Elevated sugars for that long COULD maybe be an infection somewhere or a surge in hormones (has she started menarche yet?). I know MY blood sugars get through the stratosphere just before my period. I have to increase my NPH or intermediate acting insulin when this happens.Can I support you into getting it looked into by your physician? Better to be safe than sorry. Poor girl must be feeling really yucky! My empathies!

question: hi, my 11 year old daughter's blood sugar is staying above 15 mmol everytime she tests. she takes insulin three times a day and i have increased all of them alot. it does not change anything. This has been going on for a week now. what should i do??
title: blood sugar staying high
